blogPosts.content:
import PostMeta from "@site/src/components/PostMeta";

<PostMeta category="business-compliance" />

**City compliance requirements**
--------------------------------

City regulations can affect small business operations. The local regulatory requirements that may apply to small businesses are:

1\. Zoning Permits

2\. City Business License

3\. Building Permits

4\. Site Inspection

5\. Local Taxes

**For More details**, check _**[local municipality website](https://clintonma.gov)**_

**Small Business Federal Requirements**
---------------------------------------

Most common Federal Requirments are:

\- Federal taxes

\- Affordable Care Act (for businesses with 50 or more employees)

\- Federal licenses, permits or certificates

\- Marketing and advertising laws

\- Copywright laws

\- Workplace poster laws

\- Workplace health and safety laws

\- Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA)

For more details on the US Federal Regulations, please refer to **[this section.](../federal-regulations/)**

Local Regulations
------------------------
**Massachusetts (MA) State Requirements**
-----------------------------------------

Massachusetts (MA) State Requirements for Small Business can be found in [**this section.**](/ma-state-regulations-small-business-requirements)

Checklist for Small Business Compliance
---------------------------------------

\- Zoning Regulations

\- Business License

\- Business Name Registration

\- Legal Structure

\- State Taxes

\- Property Assessment

\- State & Federal Labor Laws

\- State Withholding

\- State Unemployment Insurance

\- Workers’ Compensation Insurance

\- Permits, Licenses & Inspections

\- Employer Identification Number (EIN)

\- Federal Unemployment Tax (FUTA)

\- Health Insurance (Affordable Care Act)

Helpful Small Business Websites
-------------------------------

1.  [\- Small Business Administration Business Start-Up Guide](https://www.sba.gov/business-guide)
2.  [\- Application for Employer Identification Number (EIN)/Tax ID Number](https://www.irs.gov/businesses/small-businesses-self-employed/apply-for-an-employer-identification-number-ein-online)
3.  [\- Internal Revenue Service (IRS) Starting a Business and Keeping Records Form (PDF)](https://www.irs.gov/pub/irs-pdf/p583.pdf)
4.  [\- Patents and Trademarks](https://www.uspto.gov/)
5.  [\- Free Market Research](https://www.sba.gov/blogs/)
6.  [\- US Senate Small Business Resources](https://www.sbc.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/resources)

Cities
-----------------------------------------
Clinton

Checklist for Small Business Compliance
---------------------------------------

\- Zoning Regulations

\- Business License

\- Business Name Registration

\- Legal Structure

\- State Taxes

\- Property Assessment

\- State & Federal Labor Laws

\- State Withholding

\- State Unemployment Insurance

\- Workers’ Compensation Insurance

\- Permits, Licenses & Inspections

\- Employer Identification Number (EIN)

\- Federal Unemployment Tax (FUTA)

\- Health Insurance (Affordable Care Act)

**Small Business Federal Requirements**
---------------------------------------

Most common Federal Requirments are:

\- Federal taxes

\- Affordable Care Act (for businesses with 50 or more employees)

\- Federal licenses, permits or certificates

\- Marketing and advertising laws

\- Copywright laws

\- Workplace poster laws

\- Workplace health and safety laws

\- Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA)

For more details on the US Federal Regulations, please refer to **[this section.](../federal-regulations/)**

Checklist for Small Business Compliance
---------------------------------------

\- Zoning Regulations

\- Business License

\- Business Name Registration

\- Legal Structure

\- State Taxes

\- Property Assessment

\- State & Federal Labor Laws

\- State Withholding

\- State Unemployment Insurance

\- Workers’ Compensation Insurance

\- Permits, Licenses & Inspections

\- Employer Identification Number (EIN)

\- Federal Unemployment Tax (FUTA)

\- Health Insurance (Affordable Care Act)

Helpful Small Business Websites
-------------------------------

1.  [\- Small Business Administration Business Start-Up Guide](https://www.sba.gov/business-guide)
2.  [\- Application for Employer Identification Number (EIN)/Tax ID Number](https://www.irs.gov/businesses/small-businesses-self-employed/apply-for-an-employer-identification-number-ein-online)
3.  [\- Internal Revenue Service (IRS) Starting a Business and Keeping Records Form (PDF)](https://www.irs.gov/pub/irs-pdf/p583.pdf)
4.  [\- Patents and Trademarks](https://www.uspto.gov/)
5.  [\- Free Market Research](https://www.sba.gov/blogs/)
6.  [\- US Senate Small Business Resources](https://www.sbc.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/resources)

**Texas (TX) State Requirements**
---------------------------------

\- Incorporating Your Business

\- Business Property Assessment

\- State Labor Laws

\- State Withholding Tax

\- Sales Tax

\- Special Licenses, Permits, Inspections

\- Insurance Requirements

Texas (TX) State Requirements for Small Business can be found in **[this website.](https://gov.texas.gov/business/page/small-business)**

**Small Business Federal Requirements**
---------------------------------------

Most common Federal Requirments are:

\- Federal taxes

\- Affordable Care Act (for businesses with 50 or more employees)

\- Federal licenses, permits or certificates

\- Marketing and advertising laws

\- Copywright laws

\- Workplace poster laws

\- Workplace health and safety laws

\- Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA)

For more details on the US Federal Regulations, please refer to **[this section.](../federal-regulations/)**

\- Zoning Regulations

\- Business License

\- Business Name Registration

\- Legal Structure

\- State Taxes

\- Property Assessment

\- State & Federal Labor Laws

\- State Unemployment Insurance

\- Workers’ Compensation Insurance

\- Permits, Licenses & Inspections

\- Employer Identification Number (EIN)

\- Federal Unemployment Tax (FUTA)

\- Health Insurance (Affordable Care Act)

**Ohio (OH) State Requirements**
--------------------------------

\- Incorporating Your Business

\- Business Property Assessment

\- State Labor Laws

\- State Withholding Tax

\- Sales Tax

\- Special Licenses, Permits, Inspections

\- Insurance Requirements

Ohio (OH) State Requirements for Small Business can be found in **[this website.](https://www.sos.state.oh.us/businesses/)**

**Small Business Federal Requirements**
---------------------------------------

Most common Federal Requirments are:

\- Federal taxes

\- Affordable Care Act (for businesses with 50 or more employees)

\- Federal licenses, permits or certificates

\- Marketing and advertising laws

\- Copywright laws

\- Workplace poster laws

\- Workplace health and safety laws

\- Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA)

For more details on the US Federal Regulations, please refer to **[this section.](../federal-regulations/)**

Checklist for Small Business Compliance
---------------------------------------

\- Zoning Regulations

\- Business License

\- Business Name Registration

\- Legal Structure

\- State Taxes

\- Property Assessment

\- State & Federal Labor Laws

\- State Withholding

\- State Unemployment Insurance

\- Workers’ Compensation Insurance

\- Permits, Licenses & Inspections

\- Employer Identification Number (EIN)

\- Federal Unemployment Tax (FUTA)

\- Health Insurance (Affordable Care Act)

**Michigan (MI) State Requirements**
------------------------------------

\- Incorporating Your Business

\- Business Property Assessment

\- State Labor Laws

\- State Withholding Tax

\- Sales Tax

\- Special Licenses, Permits, Inspections

\- Insurance Requirements

Michigan (MI) State Requirements for Small Business can be found in **[this website.](https://www.michigan.gov/som/business)**

**Small Business Federal Requirements**
---------------------------------------

Most common Federal Requirments are:

\- Federal taxes

\- Affordable Care Act (for businesses with 50 or more employees)

\- Federal licenses, permits or certificates

\- Marketing and advertising laws

\- Copywright laws

\- Workplace poster laws

\- Workplace health and safety laws

\- Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA)

For more details on the US Federal Regulations, please refer to **[this section.](../federal-regulations/)**

**Iowa (IA) State Requirements**
--------------------------------

\- Incorporating Your Business

\- Business Property Assessment

\- State Labor Laws

\- State Withholding Tax

\- Sales Tax

\- Special Licenses, Permits, Inspections

\- Insurance Requirements

Iowa (IA) State Requirements for Small Business can be found in **[this website.](https://sos.iowa.gov/business/StartingABusiness/search.aspx#)**

**Small Business Federal Requirements**
---------------------------------------

Most common Federal Requirments are:

\- Federal taxes

\- Affordable Care Act (for businesses with 50 or more employees)

\- Federal licenses, permits or certificates

\- Marketing and advertising laws

\- Copywright laws

\- Workplace poster laws

\- Workplace health and safety laws

\- Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA)

For more details on the US Federal Regulations, please refer to **[this section.](../federal-regulations/)**

Checklist for Small Business Compliance
---------------------------------------

\- Zoning Regulations

\- Business License

\- Business Name Registration

\- Legal Structure

\- State Taxes

\- Property Assessment

\- State & Federal Labor Laws

\- State Withholding

\- State Unemployment Insurance

\- Workers’ Compensation Insurance

\- Permits, Licenses & Inspections

\- Employer Identification Number (EIN)

\- Federal Unemployment Tax (FUTA)

\- Health Insurance (Affordable Care Act)

-------------------------------

1.  [\- Small Business Administration Business Start-Up Guide](https://www.sba.gov/business-guide)

5.  [\- Free Market Research](https://www.sba.gov/blogs/)
6.  [\- US Senate Small Business Resources](https://www.sbc.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/resources)

**Ilinois (IL) State Requirements**
-----------------------------------

\- Incorporating Your Business

\- Business Property Assessment

\- State Labor Laws

\- State Withholding Tax

\- Sales Tax

\- Special Licenses, Permits, Inspections

\- Insurance Requirements

Ilinois (IL) State Requirements for Small Business can be found in **[this website.](https://www.illinois.gov/business/registration-licenses-permits.html)**

**Small Business Federal Requirements**
---------------------------------------

Most common Federal Requirments are:

\- Federal taxes

\- Affordable Care Act (for businesses with 50 or more employees)

\- Federal licenses, permits or certificates

\- Marketing and advertising laws

\- Copywright laws

\- Workplace poster laws

\- Workplace health and safety laws

\- Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA)

For more details on the US Federal Regulations, please refer to **[this section.](../federal-regulations/)**

import PostMeta from "@site/src/components/PostMeta";

<PostMeta category="business-compliance" />

Federal
-------

**1+ Employee**

Fair Labor Standards Act (FLSA), [via DoL](http://www.dol.gov/whd/flsa/)  
Employers must properly classify and pay employees a corresponding minimum wage, while following overtime and child labor standards. Defines exempt (not entitled to overtime) vs. non-exempt (entitled to overtime and scheduled breaks) employee restrictions.

Immigration Reform & Control Act (IRCA), [via DoL](http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/ca_irca.htm)  
Employers may only hire those who can legally work in the United States and must maintain up-to-date I-9 forms for all employees.

Employment Retirement Income Security Act (ERISA), [via DoL](http://www.dol.gov/dol/topic/health-plans/erisa.htm)  
Employers’ private pension and health plans must give participants information around plan features, funding, and responsibilities. One key ERISA amendment includes COBRA (see below).

Federal Income Tax Withholding, [via IRS](http://www.irs.gov/Individuals/International-Taxpayers/Federal-Income-Tax-Withholding)  
Employers must withhold and pay the federal government a set percentage of employee wages for the federal government.

Federal Insurance Contribution Act (FICA), [via IRS](http://www.irs.gov/taxtopics/tc751.html)  
Employers must withhold and pay the federal government a set percentage of employee wages for Social Security and Medicare.

Equal Pay Act (EPA), [via EEOC](http://www.eeoc.gov/laws/statutes/epa.cfm)  
Employers must pay male and female employees the same wage for the same job. One key amendment includes the Lilly Ledbetter Fair Pay Act.

Uniformed Services Employment & Reemployment Rights Act (USERRA), [via DoL](http://www.dol.gov/compliance/laws/comp-userra.htm)  
Employers must permit employees to be absent from work for military duty and retain reemployment rights for up to five years, as well as make reasonable efforts to accommodate veterans’ disabilities.

National Labor Relations Act (NLRA), [via NLRB](https://www.nlrb.gov/resources/national-labor-relations-act)  
Employers cannot prohibit employees from or discipline them for forming or joining unions. One key amendment, the Labor Management Relations Act, grants employers an equal position in union-employee-employer disputes and outlines dispute procedures.

Uniform Guidelines for Employment Selection Procedures, [via EEOC](http://www.eeoc.gov/policy/docs/qanda_clarify_procedures.html)  
Employers may not discriminate against employees or applicants on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, or national origin.

Employee Polygraph Protection Act (EPPA), [via DoL](http://www.dol.gov/compliance/laws/comp-eppa.htm)  
Employers cannot use lie detector tests in pre-employment screening or during employment (with some exceptions).

Sarbanes-Oxley Act (SOX), [via SEC](http://www.sec.gov/about/laws.shtml#sox2002)  
Public companies must follow set mandates to enhance corporate responsibility, combat fraud and provide financial disclosures.

Consumer Credit Protection Act (CCPA), [via DoL](http://www.dol.gov/compliance/laws/comp-ccpa.htm)  
Employers must follow employee wage garnishment requirements.

Fair and Accurate Credit Transactions Act (FACT), via [Federal Register](https://www.federalregister.gov/regulations/3084-AA94/fair-and-accurate-credit-transactions-act-of-2003)  
Employers must dispose carefully dispose of consumer credit information to prevent unauthorized access.

Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA), [via HHS](http://www.hhs.gov/ocr/privacy/hipaa/understanding/consumers/employers.html)  
Employers cannot receive health care information about employees from health care providers.

Occupational Safety and Health Act (OSHA), [via OSHA](http://www.dol.gov/compliance/laws/comp-osha.htm)  
Employers must follow federally-set standards providing safe employment conditions, hazard communication, and personal protective equipment.

**11+ Employees**

Recordkeeping, the Occupational Safety and Health Act (OSHA), [via OSHA](http://www.dol.gov/compliance/laws/comp-osha.htm)  
Employers of this size must maintain records in compliance with OSHA, mentioned above.

**15+ Employees**

American with Disabilities Act (ADA), [via DoL](http://www.dol.gov/dol/topic/disability/ada.htm)  
Employers may not discriminate against people with disabilities in employment, transportation, public accommodation, communications, and governmental activities.

Genetic Information Nondiscrimination Act (GINA), [via EEOC](http://www.eeoc.gov/laws/types/genetic.cfm)  
Employers may not discriminate against employees or applicants based on genetic information (genetic risk factors, family medical history, disease susceptibility, etc.).

Title VII, Civil Rights Act of 1964, [via EEOC](http://www.eeoc.gov/laws/statutes/titlevii.cfm)  
Title VII prohibits sexual harassment and other forms of sex discrimination in workplaces. Key expansions and amendments include the Lilly Ledbetter Fair Pay Act and the Civil Rights Act of 1991.

**20+ Employees**

Age Discrimination in Employment Act (ADEA), [via EEOC](http://www.eeoc.gov/laws/statutes/adea.cfm)  
Employers may not discriminate in hiring practices against workers age 40 and older.

Consolidated Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act (COBRA), [via DoL](http://www.dol.gov/dol/topic/health-plans/cobra.htm)  
Employers must offer covered employees and their families the option to continue health insurance for 18-36 months after ceasing employment (duration depends on circumstances). Employees may be required to pay full insurance premiums.

**50+ Employees**

Affordable Care Act (ACA), [via HHS](http://www.hhs.gov/healthcare/rights/)  
Employers of this size are classified as Applicable Large Employers (ALEs) under the ACA and must offer affordable health insurance options, as defined by the law, with strict recordkeeping requirements. Note that this mandate applies to 50+ “full-time equivalent” workers. We’ve deciphered the ACA for you [here](https://www.zenefits.com/blog/top-5-things-know-about-aca/).

Family and Medical Leave Act (FMLA), [via DoL](http://www.dol.gov/whd/fmla/)  
Employers must offer up to 12 weeks of unpaid, job-protected leave to eligible employees following the birth, adoption, or foster placement of an employee’s child or serious family illness.

Affirmative Action Program (AAP), [via DoL](http://www.dol.gov/dol/topic/hiring/affirmativeact.htm)  
Employers must create programs to actively recruit and train minorities, women, disabled persons and covered veterans, with accompanying recordkeeping requirements.

**100+ Employees**

Worker Adjustment Retraining Notification Act (WARN), [via DoL](http://www.dol.gov/compliance/laws/comp-warn.htm)  
Employers must notify employees at least 60 calendar days in advance of workplace closings and mass layoffs.

EEO-1 Survey Filing (Title VII, Civil Rights Act of 1964), [via EEOC](http://www.eeoc.gov/employers/eeo1survey/whomustfile.cfm)  
In compliance with Title VII, employers must maintain diversity records for workplaces and individual employees. If the organization is a federal contractor, this threshold becomes 50+ employees.

**Employers with federal contracts, any size**

Employers of all sizes with federal contracts have additional compliance requirements and modified thresholds mandated by laws not outlined above, including:

*   Davis-Bacon Act
*   Drug Free Workplace Act
*   Contract Work Hours and Safety Standards Act (CWHSSA)
*   McNamara-O’Hara Service Contract Act (SCA)
*   Executive Order 11246
*   Vietnam Era Veterans’ Readjustment Act
*   Vocational Rehabilitation Act
*   Walsh-Healy Act
*   Copeland Act

Checklist for Small Business Compliance
---------------------------------------

\- Zoning Regulations

\- Business License

\- Business Name Registration

\- Legal Structure

\- State Taxes

\- Property Assessment

\- State & Federal Labor Laws

\- State Withholding

\- State Unemployment Insurance

\- Workers’ Compensation Insurance

\- Permits, Licenses & Inspections

\- Employer Identification Number (EIN)

\- Federal Unemployment Tax (FUTA)

\- Health Insurance (Affordable Care Act)
